metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0742 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The resolver in nginx before 1.8.1 and 1.9.x before 1.9.10 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (invalid pointer dereference and worker process crash) via a crafted UDP DNS response.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0742` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

nginx - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.4
nginx-common - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.4
nginx-core - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.4
nginx-extras - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.4
nginx-full - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.4
nginx-light - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.4
nginx-naxsi - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.4
nginx-naxsi-ui - 1.4.6-1ubuntu3.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nginx package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.6-1ubuntu3.4').
